<html><body><div><p class="article__summary">Rep. Maxine Dexter will visit a Texas detention facility Thursday to check on a family detained while taking their sick 7-year-old to care in Portland.</p>
        <div class="article__body">
                    <div class="article__section article__section_type_text utility__text">
<p>OREGON, USA — Rep. Maxine Dexter will travel to a Texas detention facility Thursday and Friday to check on <a href="/article/news/politics/immigration-news/gresham-family-asylum-detained-adventist-hospital-portland-border-patrol/283-c50104d0-e0bc-40de-9ab5-84c0cb34ed2f" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">a Gresham family detained </a>while taking their sick 7-year-old child to a hospital, her office announced Tuesday.</p>                    </div>
                    <div class="article__section article__section_type_text utility__text">
<p>The Crespo-Gonzalez family was detained Jan. 16 at Adventist Health Portland and is now being held at the Dilley, Texas facility, which has two documented active measles cases, according to Dexter's office.</p>                    </div>
                        
                    <div class="article__section article__section_type_text utility__text">
<p>According to Dexter and the Portland Immigrant Rights Coalition, the couple took their daughter to the hospital for a nosebleed when they were surrounded by U.S. Border Patrol agents and taken into custody before the child could be treated.</p>                    </div>
                    <div class="article__section article__section_type_text utility__text">
<p>"No child, but especially not a sick second-grader on the way to urgent care, should be detained by ICE and then trapped in a facility with active measles cases," said Dexter, one of six Democratic physicians serving in Congress. "I cannot stand by while my constituents' rights are stripped, and our country's values eroded."</p>                    </div>
                                
                    <div class="article__section article__section_type_text utility__text">
<p>Dexter said she will assess the conditions of the family's detention and ensure their access to due process. She said she is fully vaccinated against measles and will take proper precautions.</p>                    </div>
                    <div class="article__section article__section_type_text utility__text">
<p>Dexter said her office has made numerous inquiries on behalf of the Crespo-Gonzalez family, including requesting a wellness check, medical attention and an explanation of the basis for their detention, according to her office.</p>                    </div>
                    <div class="article__section article__section_type_text utility__text">
<p>The family had an active asylum case with a 2028 immigration court date and no criminal history, Dexter told <a href="/article/news/politics/immigration-news/gresham-family-asylum-detained-adventist-hospital-portland-border-patrol/283-c50104d0-e0bc-40de-9ab5-84c0cb34ed2f" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">KGW in a late January interview</a>. The child developed a fever while in custody but is now stable, she said at the time.</p>                    </div>
                    <div class="article__section article__section_type_text utility__text">
<p>The Department of Homeland Security said <a href="/article/news/politics/immigration-news/gresham-family-asylum-detained-adventist-hospital-portland-border-patrol/283-c50104d0-e0bc-40de-9ab5-84c0cb34ed2f" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">in a statement to KGW</a> in late January regarding the detainment that Yohendry De Jesus Crespo and Darianny Liseth Gonzalez de Crespo "illegally" entered the U.S. with their daughter in 2024 after applying for asylum through the <a href="https://www.americanimmigrationcouncil.org/fact-sheet/cbp-one-overview/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">CBP One app</a>, and were released by the Biden administration. The statement said the family will remain in ICE custody while their asylum claims are heard by an immigration judge.</p>                    </div>
                    <div class="article__section article__section_type_text utility__text">
<p>The detention occurred less than 1,000 feet from where a <a href="/article/news/politics/immigration-news/border-patrol-shooting-woman-portland-guilty-probation-illegal-entry/283-76818917-29a7-4891-8d22-1ca98fc7bfe8" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Border Patrol shooting of two Venezuelan immigrants</a> took place earlier in January, according to Dexter.</p>                    </div>
                                
                    <div class="article__section article__section_type_text utility__text">
<p>Earlier Tuesday, <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6AstBUkOkJw" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Dexter joined Democrats</a> outside ICE headquarters in Washington, D.C., calling for Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem to be impeached.</p>                    </div>
                    <div class="article__section article__section_type_text utility__text">
<p>Dexter represents Oregon's 3rd Congressional District, which includes most of Portland.</p>                    </div>
                    <div class="article__section article__section_type_text utility__text">
<p><em id="isPasted">KGW digital producer Jamie Parfitt and reporter Celine Stevens contributed to this story.</em></p>                    </div>
